title: Irago Tōdai-ji Tile Kiln ruins
text:
The is an <a href="archaeological%20site">archaeological site</a> containing the remnants of a number of <a href="Anagama%20kiln">Anagama kiln</a>s, from which the <a href="roof%20tile">roof tile</a>s for the <a href="Kamakura%20period">Kamakura period</a> reconstruction of the temple of <a href="T%C5%8Ddai-ji">Tōdai-ji</a> in <a href="Nara%20%28city%29">Nara</a> were made. The site is located in the Irago neighborhood of the city of <a href="Tahara%2C%20Aichi">Tahara</a>, <a href="Aichi%20Prefecture">Aichi Prefecture</a> in the <a href="T%C5%8Dkai%20region">Tōkai region</a> of <a href="Japan">Japan</a>. It was designated a <a href="Monuments%20of%20Japan">National Historic Site of Japan</a> in 1967.
Overview.
In 1180 AD, during the <a href="Genpei%20War">Genpei War</a> of the late <a href="Heian%20period">Heian period</a>, the great temple of Tōdai-ji was burned down by <a href="Taira%20clan">Heike</a> forces. The temple was rebuilt by the <a href="Kamakura%20shogunate">Kamakura shogunate</a> in 1195 AD. During the construction of the Hatsutachiike irrigation dam at the tip of <a href="Atsumi%20Peninsula">Atsumi Peninsula</a> in 1966, the remnants of a kiln were discovered. This lent evidence to local legend that the tiles for the temple of Tōdai-ji had been produced from clay in this area. Further investigation of shards found at the site, as well as earlier finds from the <a href="Edo%20period">Edo period</a> in this neighborhood, revealed a number of ink markings and inscriptions which were identical to markings on existing tiles preserved at Tōdai-ji. A more detailed <a href="archaeological%20excavation">archaeological excavation</a> revealed that the site consisted of three "<a href="noborigama">noborigama</a>"-style kilns and one flat kiln. 
The kilns were from 11.5 to 12.3 meters in length, and had a maximum width of 2.5 meters. Excavated items are now displayed at the Folklore Museum of Tahara City. The site is located a 20-minute walk from the "Kameyama Nishi" bus stop on the Toyotetsu Bus from the <a href="Mikawa%20Tahara%20Station">Mikawa Tahara Station</a> on the <a href="Toyohashi%20Railroad%20Atsumi%20Line">Toyohashi Railroad Atsumi Line</a>.
